result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
Ignition Interlock Device Tampering/Failure to Install/Violate Court Order

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. George Phillip Nord Jr.

records.addlTxt:
10:47 AM Defendant George Phillip Nord Jr. in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for George Phillip Nord Jr.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 22CF222, 22CF223, and 22CT76. In 22CF222 and 22CF223, Attorney acknowledges receipt of the information, waives a formal reading, enters a plea of not guilty and requests status conference 45-60 days out.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt:
22CF222 and 22CF223 for preliminary hearing, 22CT76 for STC
11:10 AM Defendant George Phillip Nord Jr. in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for George Phillip Nord Jr.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing in both CF files. Court finds waivesr knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment. Court reminds of bail/conditions.
Arraignment scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 10:00 am.

$1500 already posted - No contact with Victim 1 (Tim Ranslow), No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license, No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.

1:52 PM Prosecuting attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant George Phillip Nord Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman appeared by video for George Phillip Nord Jr. Court calls cases 22CF222, 22CF223, and 22CT76. Defendant's address confirmed. Court notes warrants in all files due to missed appearance. Court quashes warrant, questions non appearance. Attorney Hoffman indicates that defendant missed appearance yesterday and was taken into custody last night when he came to the jail to post on girlfriend's jail account. Defendant makes statement. State reviews bail in pending files. Asks for an additional $500 to be posted in each file. Prior conditions to continue. Attorney Hoffman asks court to reinstate old bond. Court reinstates bond in all files.  Court orders additional $500 in each file. Conditions to continue.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 11:15 am.

10:16 AM Defendant George Phillip Nord Jr. not in court.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman in court for George Phillip Nord Jr.  Attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Att Hoffman- no information, client did bail out
State requests warrant and bail forfeited, for Wisconsin and Minnesota
Court orders warrants on all 3 criminal matters, forfeit bail, default on 22TR1660, 60 days to pay
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. No contact with Timothy Ranslow.

1:30 PM Prosecuting attorney Peter James Marvin Kruger in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant George Phillip Nord Jr. appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Michael Charles Hoffman appeared by video for George Phillip Nord Jr. Court calls cases 22CF222, 22CF223, and 22CT76. Attorney/Defendant acknowledges receipt of all 3 complaints and receipt of the probable cause statement for case 22CF223, waives a formal reading, enters pleas of not guilty to the misdemeanor count(s), and requests a preliminary hearing. Attorney Hoffman verifies defendant's address. Asks that Count 4 in 22CF223 is dismisses. State no objection. Court dismisses Count 4 in 22CF223. 

State asks for $500 cash in 22CT76, No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license; $2,000 in 22CF223, No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription, No contact with Timothy Ranslow; $1,000 in 22CF222 No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 

State recites previous criminal history, reviews the allegations in each of the new cases, and stresses the number of cases accrued in a short period of time. State reviews defendant's FTAs in MN cases. Indicates that the defendant was driving while revoked in numerous cases and attempted to flee from officers. Notes concerns over ability to follow court orders.  Attorney Hoffman indicates lifetime resident of Douglas County, is not on probation or parole, defendant can post up to $300. 

Court orders in 22CT76 $500 cash bail with conditions of No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. In 22CF222 $1,000 cash with conditions of No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription.  In 22CF223 $1,500 cash bail with conditions of No operation of a motor vehicle unless Defendant has valid permit or license. No use or possession of a controlled substance or drug-related paraphernalia without a valid prescription. No contact with Timothy Ranslow.

Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 22, 2022 at 10:15 am.
